messages.name: IdDocument
messages.description:
IdDocument represents a set of data describing the ID including mechanisms such as:
  - cryptographic public keys - used to authenticate itself and prove
    association with the ID
  - node - the node that was used to publish the document

An ID Document can be retrieved by resolving an ID.

fields.name: id
fields.description:
The ID
The metadata below is related as claims to the ID
fields.label: optional

fields.name: node
fields.description: The node that was used to publish the document
fields.label: optional

fields.name: verification_method
fields.description:
VerificationMethod is a list of cryptographic public keys, which can be used
to authenticate or authorize interactions with the entities represented by the ID.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: service
fields.description:
Service is used in ID Documents to express ways of communicating with
the node that published the document.
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: assertion_method
fields.description:
AssertionMethod is used to specify how the entity represented by the ID
is expected to express claims, such as for the purposes of issuing a VCs.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Jwk
messages.description:
JWK represents:
- a JSON Web Key (JWK) with the respective fields specific to RSA algorithms.
- a Quantum JSON Web Key (QJWK) with the respective fields specific to AKP algorithms.

fields.name: alg
fields.description:
ALG represents the algorithm intended for use with the key.
Example algorithms for Post-Quantum ML-DSA family:
"ML-DSA-44", "ML-DSA-65", "ML-DSA-87".
Some example algorithms are "RS256", "RS384", "RS512" for RSA algorithms.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: kty
fields.description:
KTY represents the key type parameter.
It specifies the family of quantum algorithms used with the key,
such as "AKP" for post quantum algorithms
or "RSA" for non quantum algorithms.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: use
fields.description:
Use represents the intended use of the key.
Some example values are "enc" and "sig".
fields.label: optional

fields.name: kid
fields.description:
KID represents the key ID.
It is used to match a specific key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: pub
fields.description: The public key for the AKP kty.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: priv
fields.description: The private key for the AKP kty.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: seed
fields.description: Seed used to derive keys for ML-DSA alg.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: e
fields.description: The exponent for the RSA public key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: n
fields.description: The modulus for the RSA public key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: d
fields.description: The private exponent for the RSA kty.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: p
fields.description: The first prime factor for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: q
fields.description: The second prime factor for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: dp
fields.description: The first factor CRT exponent for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: dq
fields.description: The second factor CRT exponent for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: qi
fields.description: The first CRT coefficient for the RSA private key.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Jwks
messages.description: JWKS represents a set of JSON Web Keys (JWKs).

fields.name: keys
fields.description: Keys represents the list of JSON Web Keys.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: Service
messages.description:
Service is used in ID Documents to express ways of communicating with
the node that published the document.

fields.name: service_endpoint
fields.description:
ServiceEndpoint is a network address, such as an HTTP URL, of the
node.
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: VerificationMethod
messages.description:
VerificationMethod expresses verification methods, such as cryptographic
public keys, which can be used to authenticate or authorize interactions
with the entities represented by the ID. It is a part of the ID Document.

fields.name: id
fields.description: A unique id of the verification method.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: public_key_jwk
fields.description: The public key used for the verification method.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Issuer
messages.description: A Identity Issuer

fields.name: organization
fields.description: The organization of the issuer
fields.label: optional

fields.name: sub_organization
fields.description: The sub organization of the issuer
fields.label: optional

fields.name: common_name
fields.description:
The common name of the issuer
Could be a FQDN or a FQDA
fields.label: optional

fields.name: public_key
fields.description:
This field is optional
The keys of the issuer in JWK format
The public key is used to verify the signature of the different claims
fields.label: optional

fields.name: private_key
fields.description:
This field is optional
The private key of the issuer in JWK format
fields.label: optional

enums.name: CredentialContentType
enums.description:
The content of the Credential.
Multiple content types can be supported: AgentBadge, AgentPassport, etc.

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_AGENT_BADGE
values.description:
AgentBadge Content Type.
The Agent content representation following a defined schema
OASF: https://schema.oasf.agntcy.org/schema/objects/agent
Google A2A: https://github.com/google/A2A/blob/main/specification/json/a2a.json

values.name: CREDENTIAL_CONTENT_TYPE_AGENT_PASSPORT
values.description:
AgentPassport Content Type.
The Agent passport is a verifiable presentation that aggregates all the
agent badges of the agent.
It can also be accessed on a well-known URL
of type: {agent_id}/.well-known/passport.json

enums.name: CredentialEnvelopeType
enums.description:
The Envelope Type of the Credential.
Multiple envelope types can be supported: Embedded Proof, JOSE, COSE etc.

messages.name: AgentPassport
messages.description: AgentPassport represents a Verifiable Presentation for an agent.

fields.name: context
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#contexts
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: type
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model/#dfn-type
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: verifiable_credential
fields.description: https://www.w3.org/2018/credentials#verifiableCredential
fields.label: repeated

fields.name: proof
fields.description: https://w3id.org/security#proof
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CredentialContent
messages.description: CredentialContent represents the content of a Verifiable Credential.

fields.name: content_type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the content of the credential.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: content
fields.description: The content representation in JSON-LD format.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: CredentialSchema
messages.description:
CredentialSchema represents the credentialSchema property of a Verifiable Credential.
more information can be found [here]

[here]: https://www.w3.org/TR/vc-data-model-2.0/#data-schemas

fields.name: type
fields.description: Type specifies the type of the file
fields.label: optional

fields.name: id
fields.description: The URL identifying the schema file
fields.label: optional

messages.name: EnvelopedCredential
messages.description: EnvelopedCredential represents a Credential enveloped in a specific format.

fields.name: envelope_type
fields.description: EnvelopeType specifies the type of the envelope used to store the credential.
fields.label: optional

fields.name: value
fields.description: Value is the enveloped credential in the specified format.
fields.label: optional

messages.name: Proof
messages.description:
A data integrity proof provides information about the proof mechanism,
parameters required to verify that proof, and the proof value itself.

fields.name: type
fields.description: The type of the proof
fields.label: optional

fields.name: proof_purpose
fields.description: The proof purpose
fields.label: optional

fields.name: proof_value
fields.description: The proof value
fields.label: optional

fields.label: optional

fields.label: optional

fields.name: issuance_date

fields.label: optional

fields.name: expiration_date

fields.name: proof

messages.name: IssueVCRequest
messages.description: IssueRequest is a request to issue a VC

fields.description: ID is the identifier.

fields.name: content
fields.description: Content of the VC

fields.name: envelope_type
fields.description: Envelope type

messages.name: IssueVCResponse
messages.description: IssueResponse returns the issued VC

fields.name: vc
fields.description: The issued VC

messages.name: KeyGenResponse
messages.description: KeyGenResponse returns the generated keypair

fields.name: keypair
fields.description: The generated keypair

services.name: LocalService
services.description: LocalService is the service that provides LOCAL issuer operations.

methods.name: KeyGen
methods.description: Generate a keypair in JWK format

messages.name: GenerateRequest
messages.description: Generate an Id for an issuer

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The issuer details

messages.name: GenerateResponse
messages.description: GenerateResponse returns the Id Document

fields.name: id_document
fields.description: The Id Document corresponding to the generated Id

messages.name: ResolveRequest
messages.description: Resolve an Id to the Id Document

fields.name: id
fields.description: Id is the identifier.

messages.name: ResolveResponse
messages.description: ResolveResponse returns the Id Document

fields.name: id_document
fields.description: The Id Document resolved from the Id

services.name: IdService
services.description: IdService is the service that provides ID operations.

messages.name: IssuerWellKnownRequest
messages.description:
IssuerWellKnownRequest is the request to get the well-known JWKS document
of an issuer

fields.name: common_name
fields.description: The common name of the issuer

messages.name: IssuerWellKnownResponse
messages.description: IssuerWellKnownResponse returns the content of the well-known JWKS document

fields.name: jwks
fields.description: The well-known Json Web Key Set (JWKS) document

messages.name: RegisterRequest
messages.description: RegisterRequest is the request to register an issuer

fields.name: issuer
fields.description: The Issuer to register.

messages.name: RegisterResponse
messages.description: RegisterResponse returns the action to take to complete the registration

fields.name: uri
fields.description: A uri indicating an action to take to complete the registration.

services.name: IssuerService
services.description: IssuerService is the service that provides ISSUER node operations.

messages.name: APWellKnownRequest
messages.description: APWellKnownResponse returns the well-known document for a passport

fields.name: id
fields.description: The identifier.

messages.name: APWellKnownResponse
messages.description: APWellKnownResponse returns the well-known document for an Agent Passport

fields.name: ap
fields.description: The well-known document for an Agent Passport

messages.name: PublishRequest
messages.description: PublishRequest is a request to publish a Verifiable Credential

fields.name: vc
fields.description: The Verifiable Credential to publish

messages.name: SearchRequest
messages.description: SearchRequest is a request to seach for VCs

fields.name: id
fields.description: ID is the identifier.

fields.name: schema
fields.description: Schema is the schema of the credential contained in the VC

fields.name: content
fields.description: The credential content representation in JSON-LD format

messages.name: SearchResponse
messages.description: SearchResponse returns the VCs that match the search criteria

fields.name: vcs
fields.description: The list of VCs that match the search criteria
fields.label: repeated

messages.name: VerifyRequest
messages.description: VerifyRequest is a request to verify a Verifiable Credential

fields.name: vc
fields.description: The Verifiable Credential to verify

services.name: VcService
services.description: VC is the service that provides VC operations.

scalarValueTypes.notes: Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint32 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Inefficient for encoding negative numbers – if your field is likely to have negative values, use sint64 instead.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int32s.
Uses variable-length encoding. Signed int value. These more efficiently encode negative numbers than regular int64s.
Always four bytes. More efficient than uint32 if values are often greater than 2^28.
Always eight bytes. More efficient than uint64 if values are often greater than 2^56.
A string must always contain UTF-8 encoded or 7-bit ASCII text.
May contain any arbitrary sequence of bytes.
